page.title: 01THREE NORTH NORFOLK VILLAGES
page.content: Corpustry, Saxthorpe and Little London, on the Norwich to Holt Road, form a straggling community on either side of the river Bure. The undulating countryside, a network of arable fields, grassland, hedgerows and mixed woodland on light sandy soil, is devoted to farming amd market gardening. Employment is generally in farming. Other work is in the general store and bakery, primary school, three garages, saw mill, small plastics factory and people also work in Norwich and nearby towns. Because public transport is limited they commute by car. The post Office and 15th century St. Andrews chuch in Saxthorpe serve the whole community. The village Hall, in Corpusty, accommodates the Youth Club, Women's Institute, Mother's Union, Parish Council, Whist Drives, Bingo, Discos
